[b][color=white]Buddy Bumping [/color][/b] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]
Our Administrator [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] made a thread, regarding "Buddy Bumping," stating that people that are constantly bumping threads for their friends will suffer the consequences and have their account closed indefinitely.  He stated that he would be going after groups, and he's referring to Hack Forums groups, if groups are doing this they will be closed indefinitely. He has had enough of this bullshit.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5615054]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]BTC @ $1500+ [/color][/b]
BTC has finally broken its highest price ever, Yesterday morning (May 4th, 2017) Bitcoin was sitting at $1490 each, and today (may 5th, 2017) it has finally broken $1500. The question a lot of people have on their mind is, whether or not it's going to continue rising, or is it going to crash.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]GoTM[/color][/b]
Graphic of The Month of April ended and [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=33319][b][color=#00AAFF]SkullTraill [/color][/b][/url]took home the [url=https://hackforums.net/myawards.php?awid=47]Graphic Master[/url] award for his winning submission. [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] later on [url=https://twitter.com/HackForumsNet/status/860945677769097216]Tweeted [/url]SkullTraill's submission. The judges of GoTM would like to thank everyone for their participation and wish them better luck next in the next battle which is supposed to be held in June and the scheduled subject of the battle will be: Thread Designs [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5590099&pid=54760764#pid54760764]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[hr]
[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/Bpzto9q.png[/img]
[color=1E90FF][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443]neeuQ[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[hr]

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#408080][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Hello, and Welcome to the Hack Forums News, interview.  Before we start are there any shout outs you would like to give?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443][color=#ffffff][b]neeuQ[/b][/color][/url]: Thank you for having me. Shout outs to the Hack Forums Wiki Team for their exemplary work.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#408080][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: I know the Wiki Team has been trying really hard to get everything caught up, completely agree there.  So, a quick look over everything on your profile, you have accomplished quite a bit in just over 2 years, care to tell us how and why you originally joined us?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443][color=#ffffff][b]neeuQ[/b][/color][/url]: I originally joined Hack Forums as a referral from another friend of mine. My purpose for the first few months of joining this forum was solely for business related purposes. That is, until I involved myself with Writ3rs.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#408080][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: It appears you have taken your role quite seriously since joining as well, you have been a noted contributor to the Writing and News team, within such a short period of time.  Further you have joined numerous other groups, some of which I know are invite only.  In your short time, given your accomplishments, I must wonder, what do you consider your largest successes, and or failures in your time within the community?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443][color=#ffffff][b]neeuQ[/b][/color][/url]: One of my greatest achievements is the single fact that I have been able to lead the Wiki Team successfully during my tenure as Leader, along with producing weekly results that satisfy both sides of the same table. Though, that wouldn't have been said proudly without equal effort from all the team members who have sacrificed their time to contribute their writing and editorial skills towards the Wiki.  One of my failures that I try to rectify, even till this day, is unknowingly making the Wiki Team too dependent on my leadership abilities, or in other words, myself. One of my original goals when I took over the mantle as Wiki Team Leader was to make the Wiki Team an efficient, self-sustaining team with minimal managerial effort, while producing a consistent output (of results) per week. If anything else, fixing this underlying issue would take 3-5 months at best.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#408080][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: I can only imagine leading the Wiki Team itself is a trial itself, I was recruited for it and could never seem to get anything done.  Other than being part of Writers what other forums do you enjoy within the community, I noticed you are part of Skrill, so I can only assume you are an avid gamer as well in your free time.?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443][color=#ffffff][b]neeuQ[/b][/color][/url]: Indeed! Although my user activity in Skill (not skrill lol) is at the bare minimum, I do play certain games like Town of Salem, Left 4 Dead 2 and some old games like Delta Force and Scratch Bandicoot. I am currently in the process of opening a new private clan for a certain game under Skill's sub-forum. Though, I just can't seem to find myself the proper time for it. Let's hope that Starstruck won't kill me (or kick me, if that even matters) for it, since I was already in the talks with him about it!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#408080][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: I play Town of Salem from time to time lol, it’s a fun game that was revamped from a really old chat based game.  So aside from leading the Wiki team and playing games what are your other more interested forums you like to go through on Hack Forums?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443][color=#ffffff][b]neeuQ[/b][/color][/url]: I browse the Botnets, IRC Bots, and Zombies section from time to time. I also browse the Marketplace Discussion board, keep myself updated with the latest happenings and such.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#408080][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: I have always found that an interesting section (Botnets, IRC Bots, and Zombies).  What part of that technology do you find interesting to be keeping up with it?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443][color=#ffffff][b]neeuQ[/b][/color][/url]: I normally go there to see what sort of stuff do the HF community have their hands on in that section. Mostly have a chuckle or two about sordid questions that are asked in that section.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#408080][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: The section can be interesting at times to say the least.  So other than those few sections what other interests do you find yourself involved with in Hack Forums, any notation towards any of the groups, other than writers?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443][color=#ffffff][b]neeuQ[/b][/color][/url]: Nothing else, really. My activity on Hack Forums has almost always been a sore, besides carrying out my duties. One of the groups I'm in are just the result of me being very good friends with the group leaders/owner.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#408080][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Fair enough.   Well before we wrap this up, given your time on Hack Forums any suggestions or recommendations you would have to note?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443][color=#ffffff][b]neeuQ[/b][/color][/url]: At this point, not really.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#408080][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Well, thank you for your time and interview, look forward to seeing you posting around on the forums.
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443][color=#ffffff][b]neeuQ[/b][/color][/url]: Thank you for conducting this interview. Much appreciated!

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[hr]
posts.subject: Hack Forums News // Edition 342

[b][color=white]Podcasts...soon[/color][/b]
If you have any suggestions on what you'd like to see in podcasts or how you'd like them to be structured, let us know. We want to make podcasts enjoyable and professional. If you have any ideas, shoot them our way (not literally, please).

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/CCusU2F.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Billionaire Tim Draper Backing new Cryptocurrency[/color][/b]
Long-time bitcoin aficionado Tim Draper will be buying a new digital currency offered by a technology start-up. Draper told Reuters in an interview that he will participate in the “initial coin offering” (ICO) of Tezos. The ICO is scheduled for later this month: May 22. In addition to investing in the currency, Draper will also invest in the creator of Tezos: Ledger Solutions Inc. Draper will become the first prominent venture capitalist to openly embrace initial coin offerings. The lack of regulatory oversight for ICOs still has some investors remaining skeptical. Given the current financial environment, most venture capital firms are prohibited by agreement from getting involved in such high-risk assets.  Tezos is similar in nature to bitcoin, but its design allows for automated and decentralized upgrades. The coin was created over a span of three years by Kathleen and Arthur Breitman.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.cnbc.com/2017/05/05/billionaire-investor-tim-draper-backs-new-cryptocurrency.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Study Shows Popularity of Cryptocurrencies is Rising[/color][/b]
The first global cryptocurrency benchmarking study by the Cambridge Centre for Alternative Finance found that more than three million people are estimated to be actively using cryptocurrencies. According to this new study, the number of users involved in cryptocurrency is more than three times the previous estimates. The study gathered data from more than 100 cryptocurrency companies in 38 countries, which is an estimated 75% of the cryptocurrency industry. According to the study’s estimates, there are 35 million cryptocurrency wallets currently active. Although bitcoin has remained the dominant currency, its overall market cap share in cryptocurrencies has dropped from 86% to 72% over the last two years. In a foreword of the study, it is expressed that the current combined market value of all cryptocurrencies is nearly $40 billion.[i][size=x-small][url=https://phys.org/news/2017-05-highlights-significance-cryptocurrencies.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Russia Announces Legalization of Cryptocurrency use[/color][/b]
A year after the Russian government said that trading in cryptocurrencies would result in jailtime, the same entity has announced the plan to legalize the use of cryptocurrencies. The government has confirmed it will draft a bill that makes it legal to trade bitcoin, dash, ether, and any other digital currency. The cause of this complete reversal in policy is due to the poor Russian economy that has been under strain since 2014. Due to low oil prices and sanctions imposed by the United States and European Union, the cost of accessing money increased within the country. In addition to increased costs affecting the banking sector, the sector has also been heavily affected by corruption. In the past three years, the Russian Central Bank has closed almost 100 banks in the country that have been involved in such behavior as money laundering. Closing too many banks could result in social unrest due to a resulting liquidity crisis. It is not the currencies themselves that excite the Russian government, but the transparent infrastructure upon which they are built: the blockchain. As with other technological applications, it can be adopted and adapted for a multitude of uses. If transactions are able to be monitored in real time, the government believes they may be able to better detect and prevent fraudulent activity. It is hoped that increasing transaction transparency will decrease the costs the Deposit Insurance Agency must cover to pay back bank depositors that fall victim to bank fraud.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.businessinsider.com/why-russia-legalized-cryptocurrencies-2017-5] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/HhJUcMi.png[/img][/align]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]North Korea claims CIA plotted to kill Kim Jong-un[/color][/b]
Following President Trump's promise to "solve" North Korea and end the development of nuclear weapons, North Korea has accused both US and South Korean agents of plotting to kill its Leader, Kim Jong-un. Kim Jong-un is currently regarded as one of the most notorious dictators of this day and age. The North Korean ministry of state security claims a North Korean (referred to only as "Kim") was paid to carry out an attack with biochemical substances. The fate of "Kim" is currently unknown. While plots to rid the world of Kim Jong-Un may have been hatched, the statement should be treated with skepticism, for how would anyone get access to Kim Jong-un, a man perpetually surrounded by squads of protectors and whose movements are secret? A bald statement by the media controlled by a vicious regime hardly adds up to convincing evidence. This is all following the recent news of North Korea's attempted nuclear development weapons projects, whom which on Saturday had conducted its second failed ballistic missile test in two weeks. The US, as a precaution has sent a warship to the region and installed a controversial anti-missile defence system in South Korea.
[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-39815561] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Macron Wins Presidency Over Marine Le Pen[/color][/b]
Emmanuel Macron has won the French presidential election on Sunday over far-right candidate Marine Le Pen. As of early Monday morning local time in Paris, Macron had won 64.78 percent of the vote while Le Pen had earned 35.22 percent, resulting in Macron (age 39) becoming France's youngest leader since Napoleon Bonaparte. Macron has since vowed to address his country's "social fractures". The young now-president acknowledged the "immense" task ahead of him. He also thanked those who voted for him who may not share his political ideas, but who did so "to defend the Republic from extremism."
[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/french-election-centrist-emmanuel-macron-projected-win-presidency-over-marine-n755811] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Tough new internet porn laws could force porn viewers to prove their age at the post office[/color][/b]
The new Digital Economy Act caused a stir when it was announced that thousands of people using Kodi boxes to stream illegal content in the UK could face up to 10 years in prison. Now the new rules make it more difficult for children to access adult material because of the new age verification process. This essentially could mean viewers of adult content could be made to register their age with mobile phone operators, the Department for Work and Pensions or the local post office.
[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4482168/Tough-new-internet-porn-laws.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/Jvg81mQ.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]OnePlus 5 is on its way[/color][/b]
OnePlus had a great year because of their previous products OnePlus 3 and 3T. The cell phones have been one of the best value for money handsets and are ever as yet offering like hot cakes. This year anyway, we are anticipating that the organization should acquire a fresh out of the brand new OnePlus handset and keep in mind that gossipy hearsay has been flying up from time to time, an official affirmation is at last here.
As indicated by the Verge, OnePlus has only affirmed that successor to the OnePlus 3/3T will dispatch this mid-year. It is very far-fetched that it will be known as the OnePlus 4 as the number is viewed as unfortunate in China, so OnePlus 5 is a sure thing. [i][size=x-small][url=http://tech.firstpost.com/news-analysis/oneplus-5-reportedly-confirmed-to-launch-this-summer-375112.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Facebook Shuts Oculus VR Movie Studio[/color][/b]
The Oculus Story Studio will no longer make its own material, but it will now help others to make VR-prepared content. The studio obtained recognition for its short VR-prepared movies, one of which, called Henry, about a hedgehog's birthday party, won an Emmy.
The studio has been closed after Oculus founder Palmer Luckey left the organization. Facebook did not state why he cleared out but rather the takeoff came not long after Oculus lost a $500m (£387m) court body of evidence against media firm Zenimax which said it stole exchange privileged insights. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.com/news/technology-39816382] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Opera Max Update Brings New UI, Data Savings for Facebook[/color][/b]
Opera Software has discharged a new refresh update for Opera Max, its data saving and management application for Android clients. The most prominent new component is its shrewd usefulness that recommends a well-known sustain of cards given your Android application use. Opera has likewise included data saving for Facebook with Opera Max 3.0. You'll have the capacity to get refreshes, peruse the news, and chat while setting aside to 50 percent of your data plan while utilizing Opera Max's Facebook Web application. [i][size=x-small][url=http://gadgets.ndtv.com/apps/news/opera-max-update-facebook-data-saving-1690388] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews/Tsundere.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Newest Games Inducted In "Gaming Hall of Fame"[/color][/b] 
Located in Rochester, New York at The Strong Museum of Play Donkey Kong, Pokemon Red and Green, Halo: Combat Evolved, and Street Fighter II make its way into the "Gaming Hall of Fame". This Hall of Fame was created back in 2015. The collection has a wide variety of different games spanning over many different years. Games from PC, handheld devices, and consoles. Inside the museum are different memorabilia of the games inducted, like an arcade machine of Donkey Kong or a life size Master Chief statue. Some memorable games inducted in the past consist of Sonic the Hedgehog, The Sims, and even World of Warcraft. Honorable mentions that were nominated but did not make the final list were Tomb Raider, Resident Evil, and even Microsoft's Solitaire game. In order to be accepted into this Hall of Fame, they look for their "popularity, longevity and their influence on gaming, popular culture and society." [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.com/news/technology-39817313]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Injustice 2's First DLC Characters Revealed With New Trailer[/color][/b] 
Injustice 2 will be launching soon this month on May 16 for the Xbox One and PS4. Way before the release of the game has been an announcement of the first DLC that the game has to offer. Three characters will be playable after the purchase of the DLC. A release trailer on the pack showcases three characters being Sub-Zero (Mortal Kombat), Starfire (Teen Titans), and Red Hood (works with Batman sometimes). At the current time, there has not been anything on how much the DLC cost, but what we do know is with the purchase of the Ultimate Edition (which is $100) you will be getting an additional six players. If you do not purchase the Ultimate Edition but end up getting the Digital Deluxe version, you will get the three DLC characters instead. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/injustice-2s-first-dlc-characters-revealed-with-ne/1100-6449831/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Dota 2's First Co-Op Campaign Coming This Month[/color][/b] 
Dota 2's International Battle Pass will be adding a new co-op campaign mode in Dota this year. Every single year Valve releases Battle Passes to sort of celebrate the coming of the biggest Dota 2 tournament, The International. The tournament takes place over the summer and the events prior to the big tourney is called the "Battle Pass" where Valve releases in-game content, whether it be cosmetics and various other things to show off some flashy new things for the characters. Will with the end of the school year coming up soon (for some) and the start of summer coming our way, Valve will be releasing a huge co-op campaign. Valve titles it, "Siltbreaker" and you can complete these tasks with up to three players. There are two acts, and the very first act will be coming out this month while the second act will be launching sometime in July. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dota-2s-first-co-op-campaign-coming-this-month/1100-6449830/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Speedrunner Breaks Super Mario 64 World Record[/color][/b] 
A streamer by the name of Cheese05 recently managed to be the very first person in the world to collect all 120 stars in Super Mario World 64, doing so in under two hours of time. In order to complete these speedruns in a fast manner, you have to memorize even the smallest detail of the game and execute whatever you are doing with precision to get the best results. And by doing just that, Cheese05 was able to create a world record which the speedrunning community celebrated with love and joy. The world record was beaten on May 5 where he beat the game with 120 stars in one hour, 39 minutes, 57 seconds beating the previous world record Batora324 with the record of one hour, 40 minutes, five seconds. If you would like to see the record breaking trial, you can watch all of it via this Twitch livestream re-play videos [url=https://www.twitch.tv/videos/140233669]here[/url]. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.polygon.com/2017/5/5/15558540/super-mario-64-speedrun-world-record-120-stars-cheese05]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week[sp]

[yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yo6G4LmRxRk[/yt][/sp][/align]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Cimex.png[/img][/align]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Microsoft Issues Emergency Patch For Critical RCE in Windows Malware Scanner[/color][/b]
Security researcher Tavis Ormandy discovered what has been labelled the worst Windows remote code execution vulnerability in recent memory. The flaw is focused on Windows' security engine, meaning Windows' malware scanners within Windows 7, 8.1, RT and 10 computers are vulnerable. The list of affected anti-malware software affected are as follows: Windows Defender, Windows Intune Endpoint Protection, Microsoft Security Essentials, Microsoft System Center Endpoint Protection, Microsoft Forefront Security for SharePoint, Microsoft Endpoint Protection, and Microsoft Forefront Endpoint Protection. The flaw resides in the way the Microsoft Malware Protection Engine scan files. It is possible for an attacker to craft a malicious file that could lead to memory corruption on targeted systems. The flaw has now been patched by Microsoft.[i][size=x-small]
[url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/05/windows-defender-rce-flaw.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]WikiLeaks Unveils CIA's Man-in-the-Middle Attack Tool[/color][/b]

Wikileaks has published a new batch of the Vault 7 leak, detailing a man-in-the-middle (MitM) attack tool allegedly created by the United States Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) to target local networks. Dubbed Archimedes, the newly released CIA tool, dumped on Friday, purportedly used to attack computers inside a Local Area Network (LAN).  The leaked documents describe Archimedes as a tool that lets users redirect LAN traffic from a targeted computer through a malware-infected computer controlled by the CIA before the traffic is passed on to the gateway, which is known as man-in-the-middle (MitM) attack.  Rendition Infosec founder Jake Williams also pointed out that the tool is not even originally developed by the CIA, rather appears to be a repackaged version of Ettercap – an open source toolkit for MitM attacks.[i][size=x-small]
[url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/05/cia-mitm-hacking-tool.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]
